p:
The IR spectrum of Rb 3Na(H 2C 3N 3O 3) 4·3H 2O is shown in Figure S4 in the SI. The peaks around 2700–3500 cm –1 can confirm the presence of O–H and N–H bonds. The absorption bands observed at 1706, 1579, and 1466 cm –1 are characteristics of the (H 2C 3N 3O 3) − group. The C–N, N–H, and C–O bands are located at 1380, 1250, and 1074 cm –1, respectively. The peak at 883 cm –1 may be due to the asymmetrical stretching vibration of the C 3N 3 groups. The bands at 786 and 692 cm –1 are assigned to the N–C–O and and the peak at 554 cm –1 belongs to the C=O bands.
50, 51
